title.narrative: 1% - Snakebite: A Voice for the Voiceless

description.narrative: Ensuring access to prevention, essential medicines and rehabilitation of snakebite victims in Sub-Saharan Africa

sector.narrative: Health sector policy, planning and programmes; aid to health ministries, public health administration; institution capacity building and advice
Information, education and training of the population for improving health knowledge and practice related to snakebite burden; public health and awareness campaigns
Provision of quality assured, accessible and affordable antivenom & capacitated health staff
Support organisation to represent and advocate for their members, to monitor, engage and hold government to account, and to help citizens learn to act in public sphere

title.narrative: Preventing and Treating Snakebite in Resource-Poor Settings - Theory of Change

Supporting Output: Secretariat established

description.narrative: At the beginning of 2017, a well-functioning and organised secretariat is established.

title.narrative: # of new team members for Global Snakebite Secretariat recruited.

comment.narrative: Secretariat not yet established.

title.narrative: Output 1: Capacitated CS Members

description.narrative: At the end of 2018, thanks to regular intervention by the project, targeted stakeholders have increased knowledge on snakebite envenoming and have access to a space to capitalise on this (multistakeholder group).

title.narrative: # of trained individuals regularly joining the established multi-stakeholder platforms in the target countries.

comment.narrative: Snakebite MeTA not yet established (see output 3) and CS members not yet invited.
2 CS Members per country.

title.narrative: # of trained individuals in snakebite management

comment.narrative: Targeted Civil Society Members have not yet been trained in HAI/GSI methodology.
To be reached upon completion of training.
These individuals have been trained in Kenya, Zambia and Uganda through workshops, trainings, hand-holding and seminars.

title.narrative: # of trained members of Civil Society in data collection, analysis and research in the field of Snakebite Commodities.

comment.narrative: Targeted Civil Society Members have not yet been trained in HAI/GSI methodology.
To be reached upon completion of training.

title.narrative: Outcome 4: MeTA operating

description.narrative: At the end of 2018, the locally established multi-stakeholder groups and HAI/GSI have increased capacity to function as a platform where networking, learning and exchange of snakebite-related best practices can take place.

title.narrative: # of new champions or stakeholders recruited (i.e. high-profile individuals who adopt Snakebite Envenoming as an issue and publicly advocate for it).

comment.narrative: MeTA not yet formed, nor secretariat established.

Only four targets were partially reached due to the delays within Zambia and the decision to postpone the development of an optimal method to research the snakebite burden. Where possible, 91% of the targets reached went well beyond the target imagined at the start of this two-year programme.

title.narrative: # of specific country-contextualised events organised by locally formed multi-stakeholder group in year two.

comment.narrative: MeTA not yet formed.

title.narrative: # of outcomes that reflect Health System Strengthening areas for improved prevention and treatment have been accomplished or recommended.

comment.narrative: MeTA not yet formed.

title.narrative: Outcome 2: Increased attention for snakebite burden

description.narrative: At the end of 2018, there will be increased attention for snakebite burden by the WHO, Member States, the general public and the international donor community.

title.narrative: By the end of the project Snakebite is reinstated (or in the course thereof) as a NTD by the WHO due to direct intervention by the actors participating in this project.

comment.narrative: NTD status not yet reached.

title.narrative: Road Map section of WHO Action Plan finalised by the end of the project.

comment.narrative: NTD status not yet reached.

title.narrative: % of Euro 200.000 awarded in 2019 by donor(s) after the end of the 1% funding cycle to sustain the core outcomes of the project.

comment.narrative: No future funds raised yet.
To be able to properly sustain the project's outcome we need to raise at least 200.000 for 2019. The aim, however, is to raise funding for several years.

title.narrative: # of WHA/WHO actors underscoring that snakebite should be reinstated as a NTD.

comment.narrative: No lobby efforts undertaken yet.

title.narrative: # of of people of the general public that take action on behalf of our Snakebite project by the end of 2018.

description.narrative: With 'taking action' we mean: share HAI/GSI content, participate in challenges or events or donate.

comment.narrative: No public awareness campaign started yet.

title.narrative: # of publications by external parties mentioning HAI/GSI and the Snakebite project.

comment.narrative: Will only count those as a direct result of the project.

title.narrative: # of invitations for advocates to speak as experts.

comment.narrative: Will only count those as a direct result of the project.

title.narrative: Outcome 1: Empowered CS Members

description.narrative: At the mid of 2018, targeted stakeholders have increased capacity to undertake (1) snakebite research and (2) evidence-based advocacy and awareness raising on the prevention and treatment of snakebite.

title.narrative: % of CS members with increased capacity in data collection, analysis and research as demonstrated by participating in in-country research on Snakebite Commodities.

comment.narrative: Targeted Civil Society Members have not yet been trained in HAI/GSI methodology.
We expect 50% of the trained CS members to be able to implement their new skills independently after a hand-holding period.

title.narrative: # of individuals actively engaging in multi-stakeholder platforms, and/or undertaking awareness raising activities with community members and decision-makers

comment.narrative: Targeted Civil Society Members have not yet been trained in HAI/GSI methodology.
We expect 50% of the trained CS members to be able to implement their new skills independently after a hand-holding period.

title.narrative: Output 3: Snakebite Methodologies & Data Collection

description.narrative: By mid-2018, reliable and valid methodologies for data harvesting on various aspects of Snakebite are in development and help capacitate civil society members in conducting quality research.

title.narrative: Adaptation of WHO/HAI Price, Availability, Affordability and Components in the Supply Chain methodology to research Snakebite Commodities.

comment.narrative: Methodology not adapted.

title.narrative: Desktop research is undertaken to map out existing methodologies to measure snakebite burden.

comment.narrative: Methodology not yet developed.
This will be done in consultation with the WHO, once the Road Map has been published.

title.narrative: Methodology to collect qualitative (sex-segregated) data in predetermined target areas to measure snakebite incidence according to FGDs versus hospitals in the same locale is developed.

comment.narrative: Methodology not yet developed.
Part of the qualitative research (interviewing staff at Health Clinics) will be integrated in the research mentioned in Output 3.1.

title.narrative: Output 4: Multi-stakeholder groups estbalished

description.narrative: In each target country a multi-stakeholder group has been established to discuss local, national and international issues impacting snakebite prevention and treatment locally.

title.narrative: # of meetings organised by locally established multi-stakeholder groups.

comment.narrative: No Snakebite MeTA exists at this moment.

title.narrative: # of local stakeholders (incl. snakebite experts, health professionals, civil society representatives, public and private actors), participating in multi-stakeholder groups in Kenya and Uganda

comment.narrative: No Snakebite MeTA exists at this moment.

title.narrative: Outcome 3: Research data & optimal methodologies on Snakebite available

description.narrative: In late 2018, there is increased availability of up-to-date research data on the availability and affordability of quality assured, effective anti-venoms in the target countries and a standardised optimal methodology is recognised by Snakebite experts.

title.narrative: # of publications produced by project stakeholders on the different aspects of snakebite based on evidence-based research (e.g. incidence, common species, community practices, current health system response gaps) by the end of the project.

comment.narrative: Awaiting data collection process.

title.narrative: In X target countries the adopted WHO/HAI methodology on Price, Availability and Affordability in the Supply Chain has been rolled by the end of the project.

comment.narrative: Methodology not yet developed.
The Kenyan research will start in January. Additional research in all three countries was done to assess the capacities of health clinics to manage snakebite.

title.narrative: # of reports written: By mid-2018, the collected qualitative data on snakebite incidence in targets areas in Kenya has been aggregated, shared with stakeholders and supports the development of an optimal methodology to measure snakebite incidence.

comment.narrative: Methodology not yet developed.
The Zambian report is currently in draft form (Uganda and Kenya have been finalised)

title.narrative: An optimal method to measure snakebite incidence is finalised by the end of 2018.

comment.narrative: Methodology not yet developed.
This will be done in consultation with the WHO, once the Road Map has been published.

title.narrative: Output 2: Strengthened HAI/GSI

description.narrative: On the topic of Snakebite HAI and GSI have become (1) increasingly visible, (2) are viewed as a credible source, and (3) are able to effectively advocate for political and financial support with the WHO, politicians and the international donor community.

title.narrative: # of lobby & advocacy initiatives to promote successful passage to full NTD status at STAG.

comment.narrative: Advocacy efforts had started before the project cycle, but we shall only record those taking place during the cycle.
Including the development of a briefing report & face-to-face meetings.

title.narrative: # of lobby & advocacy initiatives for WHO Action Plan development.

comment.narrative: Advocacy efforts had started before the project cycle, but we shall only record those taking place during the cycle.
After the NTD status has been established, we will start lobbying for a WHO Action Plan.

title.narrative: # of requests for advocate products or information, including download of online material.

comment.narrative: At the start of the project no products were available yet.
The secretariat will develop a variety of advocacy products which will be both proactively shared (these will not be counted here) and will be available upon request.

title.narrative: # of new champions or stakeholders recruited (i.e. high-profile individuals who adopt Snakebite envenoming as an issue and publicly advocate for it).

comment.narrative: Champions recruitment will be the result of secretariat activities.
We hope to "recruit" these individuals via contineous engagement with strategic high-profile individuals to increase the visibility of the secretariat & snakebite burden.

title.narrative: # of meaningful engagements with donors on the issue of Snakebite by the end 2018 by project stakeholders.

description.narrative: With 'meaningful engagement' we mean: submitted proposal, dialogue, personalised communication.

comment.narrative: Engagement during the project cycle will only be counted.
We aim to repeatedly engage with donors via our secretariat members to both increase their awareness and to raise additional funds.

title.narrative: # of people of the general public reached by awareness raising initiatives (both online/offline) on snakebite burden initiated by the project secretariat.

comment.narrative: No awareness raising initiatives started yet by the secretariat.

title.narrative: # of meaningful engagements with journalists on the issue of Snakebite by the end 2018 by the project secretariat.

description.narrative: With 'meaningful engagement' we mean: meetings, phone calls, webinars, interviews, personalized (online) communication

comment.narrative: No engagement with journalists taken place yet as little data had been gathered, plus no activities have taken place yet.

title.narrative: Supporting Outcome: Secretariat functioning

description.narrative: The secretariat is (a) driving the project and (b) by building awareness on snakebite of the target audiences (outcome 2), (c) supporting and capacitating partners in the south & HAI/GSI (outcome 1-4), (d) specifically targeting evidence-based policy interventions with government officials and antivenom gatekeepers.

title.narrative: % of project targets accomplished.

comment.narrative: Project not yet operating.
We aim to accomplish 100% of the project targets. This % will be calculated as # of targets accomplished/ # of targets promised.

Only four targets were partially reached due to the delays within Zambia and the decision to postpone the development of an optimal method to research the snakebite burden. Where possible, 91% of the targets reached went well beyond the target imagined at the start of this two-year programme.
